website_summaries.verdict: A quality choice for the home photo enthusiast, especially if computer-free and direct CD/DVD printing are requirements.

customer_reviews.title: good photo printer
customer_reviews.text: use this printer in my office everyday for retinal photos.. Quality is excellent. Price was about right.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful color and detail
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 of these. Wonderful color and detail. I use it with Photoshop and set to "printer manages colors".
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Good photo printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second EPSON R320, the original had a fault that could not be fixed. I use it for utility printer connected with a Mac OS 9.2.
customer_reviews.author: Zdenek Trnka

customer_reviews.title: Works okay. Pictures are good.
customer_reviews.text: It took four weeks for the printer to arrive. It works all right, but not as good as the first one we had of this model. Don't know why the difference.
customer_reviews.author: C. Woolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought the R320 after a little research and faith in the Epson name. My old Stylus color 760 printer, in my opinion, did a good job printing photos, but I wanted something a little better. I had no idea how great the photos printed from the R320 would be. All of a sudden all those photos I printed on the 760 looked dead and lifeless. You practically need a magnifing glass to see the pixcelation with the R320. Ink seems steep, but it is worth it. I actually bought another USB cable and hooked my 760 up for non photo printing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Neylon

customer_reviews.title: CD and DVD printer works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the second R320 printer I have used and for printing CDs or DVDs it works great. The feed tray can get a little touchy at times, but there are few low cost printers out there that will do the job. Software included is easy to use and makes a great looking CD or DVD.
customer_reviews.author: SanJuanRon

customer_reviews.title: Best seller ever!
customer_reviews.text: My printer broke down in the middle of a big project, and I ordered the same printer that had served me well for 4 years. It arrived way before it had to, and I really appreciate that! You are AAAAA+
customer_reviews.author: Tjody

customer_reviews.title: THANK YOU!!
customer_reviews.text: When my old printer quit, after several year's, and much printing photo's, I searched for this one. Was so glad to find it. Prints great pictures and most of all, the ink is real cheap. The package arrived on time. Packed very well! Came with full ink, I just plugged it in and printed off several pictures immediately. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Patsy Green

customer_reviews.title: I am already enjoying the easiness and professional like way this printer outputs my work and photos
customer_reviews.text: I am already enjoying the easiness and professional like way this printer outputs my work and photos. I am loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was just like the one I waned to replace
customer_reviews.text: It was just what I wanted. It was just like the one I waned to replace. Works good.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Ikerd

customer_reviews.title: This machine really does not perform well.
customer_reviews.text: This machine really does not perform well. The worst printer i every bought. nothing but problems with this one. In fact, due to this machine, i will not buy another Epson machine. Simply not worth all the headaches of operation and troubleshooting. what a mess this machine really is. took mine out into the garage and gave it the hammer and put it in the garbage and did not look back. do not buy this machine for anything.
customer_reviews.author: RhythmRancher

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I own another R 320 and know how good the printer is. Bought this as a back up to the other printer and was happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: John Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is all I hoped it would be and more. It was easy to set up, easy to use, and puts out a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in Southern California

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the trash can or dump
customer_reviews.text: Marginal color quality at best. Takes 6 cartridges which are expensive and don't last long. Limped along until shutting itself down with automated message stating "internal parts have reached service life" (whatever that means) rendering the printer inoperative. It is now a boat anchor. We are stuck with boxes of Epson cartridges which will be thrown out rather than replacing this piece of junk with another Epson product.
customer_reviews.author: lksue

customer_reviews.title: recieved broke
customer_reviews.text: Recieved this item broke. Unfortunatly I didn't hook it up for a month after I recieved it. Disgusted with the seller. Got screwed and I will never order anything on amazon that isn't through amazon. Terriable seller aside This printer is one of the very best in my opinion and recommend to many people.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't work on either of my computers. Fried out the USB connections on one. Wouldn't work at all on the other with recently installed Windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY NEECE

customer_reviews.title: black ink did not work
customer_reviews.text: I received the printer and eventually installed it to replace my old R320. Once set up I could not get the black and yellow ink to charge up. The printer was useless. Bad deal. I won't buy from this vendor anymore.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Foerster

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The printer didn't recognize genuine Epson Ink. I couldn't be more disappointed but I guess that is what I get for not buying new.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Olivotti

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer but Hard to Get Ink
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this printer for years. It's great! Most liked: Six-cartridge ink. Least liked: Paper feed could be wider. It doesn't accommodate a #10 envelope head first: sideways is okay, but head first would be better. While it does not have wireless capability, it still does a great job. Whether it's plain text or hi-res pictures, this printer is impressive. However, I still can't recommend it as replacement ink is getting harder and harder to find. I only use Epson ink because I just don't trust the aftermarket ink.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase due to amazing reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this photo printer based on some good reviews on amazon. I am very pleased with this printer. Yes it does go through ink pretty quick but I am using this printer just for photos and not regular printing. I have a different printer for printing regular documents. The printer prints out amazing pictures. I am not even using the most expensive photo paper and the pictures are that beautiful. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella Marie

customer_reviews.title: Its a great little printer and I've had mine for 6 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a great little printer and I've had mine for 6 years and it's still going strong. When it says parts are worn out you can just go online and use a code to reset the settings for several more years! I fixed that error message two years ago and it's still working.
customer_reviews.author: Danika D

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer used . I did not want to go crazy and get an expensive printer for photos. I was a little hesitant buying this since it was used but this printer did not disappoint me. I always wanted a printer that had the card slot in it so if I don't want to turn on the computer I don't have to. It is on screen. It prints beautiful pictures. Great Buy
customer_reviews.author: Diana "Sammy"

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer but printing CD/DVD is frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is great. This is by far the best printer I've ever owned. Considering the price and the quality of the picture it puts out... it's a great value! However, from the very start I've always found it a little difficult to print on CDs. Now after a few years of owning it, the printer will simply not print on CDs... it'll seemply rejects the CD trays. I don't know if this is a common problem on this model!
customer_reviews.author: Bhong

customer_reviews.title: Good but buggy
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the photos are great. However the printer often locks up when not is use for a while. Also found that any kind of magnetic device like a desktop speaker that is positioned near the left side of the printer will cause the printer to randomly lockup even during printing. The only way to unlock the printer is to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Epson R320 for art applications
customer_reviews.text: I teach bookmaking to kids & needed a printer that could print from a camera/memory card without a computer. We are printing images on handmade paper, which can be tricky. This works great, but for my purposes, it has a serious flaw: In order to get it to print the image in a usable location on the handmade paper page, I am limited to 5" x 7", & have to mask off part of the image. But for the price, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lemon

customer_reviews.title: BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best printer best buy had and so i bought it and to my surprise it totally kicks ass i love this thing i've been takeing photos and printing them with studio quality. my family was amazed with the speed from flash to photo in under 5 minuts. great printer.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mortillaro

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works...
customer_reviews.text: It is great when the heads are not clogged, but heads clog all the time and to clean them takes 2 sets of ink cartridges, even with an aftermarket solvent. It used ink so fast, it is cheaper to just buy a new one. I wish I had instead of all the money on ink.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Chick

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been buggy since day one. Then it seemed the ink ran out ridiculously fast, even when printing in black. Now it will not let me print in black when any other color ink is out, even with a fresh black cartridge! And no work-arounds are possible. A waste of my money, my resources and my time. This is obviously a case of a company not giving a flip about their customers. Epson will NEVER receive another dime of my business.
customer_reviews.author: Sooz

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer was a surprise
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer because I wanted to print on DVD's. Never planned on using the built in screen but it has been great to see ink levels without connecting over USB. Works great with an Airport Express Print Server. Just did a backup of all my images and it labeled all 14 DVD's perfectly. The Mac software is so so but the output and usability were great. If you do use the printer connected over USB the memory card reader will mount on your computer helping to save some space. The memory card reader appears to be USB 1 so transfers were slow. This printer was a delightful surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Printing DVDs requires fresh trays
customer_reviews.text: I have the same problems with the Epson R300 that some of you are reporting with the R320 -- in fact that's why I'm reading the reviews, to see whether the DVD printing has improved. Apparently not. But the theory I'm developing is that the CD/DVD tray itself wears out. You have to buy new ones after perhaps 100 DVDs. I don't know whether Amazon carries it, but compassmicro.com had them; the product number is 1274077.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cole

customer_reviews.title: Won't print
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this printer for awhile now and I haven't had many complaints. It's loud and slow but oh well. But NOW my black and cyan cartridges were empty, but I couldn't afford two cartridges so I just bought black. However, the printer won't print - even in black - because one of the cartridges is empty. So, I don't want to print in blue, I want to print in black but since my BLUE is empty the stupid thing won't print at all. I'm using the tax return to buy a new printer and this one can go in the dump, I'm going back to HP.
customer_reviews.author: hambone

customer_reviews.title: Epson stuff doesn't last.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Epson printer I've owned and will be the last. All three are ok at first - with as-advertised to mediocre quality, then after a year or two, stuff starts to happen. Mostly with the paper feed system. Nothing is more fun than paper "jams" on every page when you're on a deadline. If you like wasting your time fixing and dealing with printers, then this is your baby. If you'd rather just get your page and get to work, well... not so much.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: If you want it for desktop publishing, DON'T BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Epson Stylus with this and was extremely disappointed in its ability to interface with desktop publishing programs such as Quark and InDesign. I should have researched it more thoroughly, but anyone looking to do anything more creative than print out pictures should NOT get this model. It is also an ink-guzzler (with more cartridges to buy!), and is very finicky about what types of media it will print on. Graphic artists beware.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer primarily to print my digital photos. I am amazed at the quality of the prints when done on Epson's photo paper. Directions for the installation were very easily understood and went without a hitch. I definetely recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: this is an awsome printer. it prints on all size paper. it has a tray so that you can even print on printable CD's. has the ink in six different cartriges so you only have to buy one at a time. it prints very fast and you don't even have to use a computer with it. if you do it plugs into it with a USB cord so it won't be your main printer
customer_reviews.author: N. Collum

customer_reviews.title: Shock and Awe
customer_reviews.text: I walked into the store and just basically looked at the printers and ended up buying the R320. Boy was I surprized for the price 179.99 less a $50 rebate at the quality that this printer puts out. FOr not doing research into printers (my old epson stopped working and needed a replacement asap) I got lucky. What a gem for a steal of a price. This is my 3rd Epson, and the best yet!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Willer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced at this site
customer_reviews.text: I like the printer - works fine but I'm wondering who is stupid enough to pay $449.99 listed on the Toyzz site? That's a TOTAL RIPOFF.
customer_reviews.author: Lologuy

customer_reviews.title: Epsom Stlylus R-340 discontinued ?
customer_reviews.text: Epson R-340 is discontinued but if you liked the ever popular glitch ridden R-220, this could offer some solace. I bought this because I could no longer find the R-220 . It is hopped up R-220 . I bought it because there is no learning curve for me. The unit has some of the same glitches as the R-220. I love the ease and quality of printing DVD's with this line of printers. Great quality and easy to find 3rd party ink cartridges !
customer_reviews.author: Mort Stonestein

customer_reviews.title: JUNK  Stay away !!
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer I have ever owned. Communication errors,wasteful ink "cleanings" and every time you need to print you must fiddle with at least two different thing to get a mediocre print. Some of the most expensive ink on the market. Buy anything but this.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cadry

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love the flip screen, and the ability to print directly onto a CD. No complaints about this printer. Am in the process of buying of buying another printer for my mother as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra D. Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Not for Mac
customer_reviews.text: I was very dissapointed to find out that I could not print Microsoft Word 98 documents or any other files in Mac's OS X classic mode. The only way to do it is to completely restart in OS 9. I was also frustrated with the lines in the pictures. I tried everything in the manual to fix this, but nothing works. I gave up and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: My opinion....
customer_reviews.text: I did NOT like the quality of photos that were printed on this machine. I returned this item and bought an HP 7760 photosmart (which was cheaper). I printed the exact same picture on the HP that I had printed on the Epson R320. There was a HUGH difference!! The Epson picture was grainy with a reddish tint to the photo. The HP photo was perfect. I would suggest foregoing the "novelty" of printing a label on a disk in exchange for better quality photos....which is what a printer is for.
customer_reviews.author: Ehlissa

customer_reviews.title: Printer Epson R320
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for the price. All features work well, does a great job printing on dvds. Photos look as good ad regular prints.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Boulger Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Rating Sale of Epson Stylus R320 Photo Inkjet Printer
customer_reviews.text: Sale of used Epson Stylus R320 Photo Inkjet Printer. The product was in good condition. I consider the sale to be a good one, but there were problems. I was able to find solutions so that I could adapt the printer to my computer. Evidently the former owner had a Windows PC and I own a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: anjord

customer_reviews.title: Ink almost costs more than the printer!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, yes the printer works great and especially for the price. What is never mentioned is that the ink is contained in 6 special cartriges that hold barely a teaspoon of ink. At Office Depot I recently paid $110 just for the ink. Once the ink runs out this time its going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: M. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: epson R320 printer
customer_reviews.text: I NEVER GOT THE PRINTER!!!! NEVER!!!!!! You should not let this person sell on Amazon.com. He has a 100% Negative rating. He never sent the other buyer theie item. Now I rated it. Now what kind of feed back will I get from YOU Amazon.com?
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S. Jenkins

product_meta.title: Epson Stylus R320 Photo Inkjet Printer
product_meta.description:
CL) EPSON STYLUS R320 Printer

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Print great photos and CDs--no PC required! A fast, full-featured performer, the Epson Stylus Photo R320 makes printing brilliant, long-lasting photos a snap! Plus, it prints directly on inkjet-printable CD-Rs and DVD-Rs, so it's easy to customize each disk with a cool, finished look.

 This versatile printer includes a color monitor to view, select, and crop photos. Print from popular memory cards or PictBridge-enabled digital cameras. For beautiful frame-ready photos, take advantage of BorderFree printing. This inkjet even connects directly to an external CD-R or Zip drive to save and print colorful moments with ease. It's all within reach with the Epson Stylus Photo R320.

 With up to 5,760 x 1,440 optimized dpi and superior 6-color Photo Inks, this printer offers precision color and detail, whatever the task at hand. And, whether printing stacks of photos or an important presentation, the Epson Stylus Photo R320 speeds through every project. With versatile, PC-free printing, brilliant image quality, and powerful performance, this inkjet offers a remarkable choice in the world of digital imaging. And, consider its convenient individual ink cartridges. When paired with Epson's high-quality, value-priced papers, it delivers a remarkably affordable, home photo printing solution.

 What's in the Box
Epson Stylus Photo R320 inkjet printer, cyan ink cartridge (T048220), light cyan ink cartridge (T048520), magenta ink cartridge (T048320), light magenta ink cartridge (T048620), yellow ink cartridge (T048420), black ink cartridge (T048120), CD print tray and software, printer documentation, CD-ROM containing printer drivers and software (Windows and Macintosh); printer cable not included
feature_bullets: 6-color photo printing at 5,760 x 1,440 optimized dpi
Up to 15 ppm black print speed; 4-by-6-inch photo in as little as 39 seconds
Accepts wide range of digital-camera memory cards
Supports inkjet-printable CD and DVD media
USB 2.0 interface, built-in preview LCD; PC/Mac

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars87 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
